result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominique R Bell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominique R Bell appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Dominique R Bell.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/14/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.

Defendant Dominique R Bell appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Dominique R Bell.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. State requests an adjournment. Defense does not object. Court grants request. Court sets matter for a final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to adjourn, filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Dominique R Bell in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/12/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.

Defendant Dominique R Bell in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of the jury trial on 8/8/22. State does not object. Court GRANTS request and reschedules the final pre-trial and jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to adjourn jury trial, filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
received and filed

Defendant Dominique R Bell in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling conference held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique R Bell in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Criminal Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nassau X.M. and Roman C.T.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dominique R Bell in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.
Notes: Paragraph 1 enhancer should be maximum term of imprisonment for the misdeameanor may be increased by not more that 6 months. DA's office will be e-filing a new complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/22/22 @ 1p
